## Distinguishing Features

A rare species thus far known only from sloping and seasonally saturated fine sediments over rock, R. lamellosa appears as small (~5mm) thalli with a smooth upper surface, v-shaped tips on a whitish-green plant. Close inspection reveals a series of thin pale flaps (&quot;lamellae&quot;) that fringe the edges of the plant.

## Similar species

No other species of Riccia has the overlapping scales of pale tissue along the margin, making this plant unmistakeable compared to others in the genus.
